moves.3... Bb4: Threatening my knight with the bishop
moves.5... Ba5: Moving the bishop out of danger
moves.6... Bb6: Moving the bishop (once again) out of danger
moves.8... Bxa5: Black takes my pawn in response
moves.9... g5: Black moves out the pawn, not realizing what my knight is capable of
moves.13. Nxb5: I take the pawn, threatening the queen
moves.13... Qb6: Moving the queen out of danger
moves.17. Nd6+: Putting the king in check and effectively killing the queen
moves.20... Bd5: Moving the bishop out of danger
moves.22... Nc6: Black threatens my queen, perhaps not thinking of the move I will make next
moves.23. Qxd7+: I take the pawn and check the king
moves.23... Kg6: Moving the king out of check
moves.24... Bxg2: Taking my pawn and threatening the rook, not realizing that it puts Black in danger
moves.26... Kf5: Moving out of check. If Black had instead moved to h5, it would have maybe saved him, or at least taken me longer to mate.
